src_text: Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology.
ref_text: Tɛknɔlɔgyikaa ditɛminasim yɛ asɛmfua bi a adwenepɔ pii na ɛwɔ mu, ɛfiri tɛknɔlɔgyi-pia anaa tɛknɔlɔgyi mparatifu a ɛma ɛyɛ sɛ nnipa hyɛberɛ yɛ biribi a ɛne nyansahunu mu mmara wɔ twaka bi ne kwan a ɛfa so da adi wɔ tɛknɔlɔgyi mu.
hyp_text: Technological determinism yɛ deɛ a ɛyɛ akyɛdeɛ a yɛwɔ ɛkwan so, a ɛyɛ technology-push a ɛwɔ deɛ a yɛdi kan no, na ɛyɛ strict sense a ɛwɔ deɛ a yɛkɔ adwumaden a ɛkwan a ɛdi kan a yɛdeɛ a ɛwɔ nnɔm a yɛdeɛ a ɛyɛ scientific laws a ɛwɔ technology.
